part2.name: Part 2 – Role-play
instructions_interlocutor: Now, Part Two. I’m going to read some situations. I want you to start or answer. First situation (choose one situation from A).
(Role-play the situation with the candidate – approximately two turns each.)
Second situation (choose one situation from B).
(Role-play the situation with the candidate – approximately two turns each.)

situations_A.interlocutor_opening: Do you want to go to the park today?
situations_A.notes: Discuss plans for going to the park.

situations_A.context: We are at a restaurant. I start.
situations_A.interlocutor_opening: What would you like to eat?

situations_A.context: We are at school. I start.
situations_A.interlocutor_opening: Can you help me with my homework?

situations_A.context: We are at a bus stop. I start.
situations_A.interlocutor_opening: Which bus goes to the city center?
situations_A.notes: Ask for directions to the city center.

situations_B.candidate_prompt: Ask me about my weekend plans.

situations_B.context: We are at a shop. You start.
situations_B.candidate_prompt: Ask me for help finding a shirt.
Ask me to play soccer this weekend.

situations_B.context: We are at the library. You start.
situations_B.candidate_prompt: Ask me about my favorite book.

part3.name: Part 3 – Comparing pictures (hotel)
instructions_interlocutor: Now, Part Three. Here’s a picture of a hotel. I have a different picture of a hotel. Let’s ask and answer questions about the two pictures. I start.

image_handling.note: Pictures and on-screen rendering handled elsewhere in the app.

part4A.name: Part 4A – Listening task
instructions_interlocutor: In Part Four I’m going to read something. I’m going to tell you about ______’s best friend. I’ll read it two times. Listen and take notes on your paper. I’ll then ask you these questions.
(Allow 10 seconds for the candidate to read the questions.)
Now I’ll read it again. (Read the script again.)
Questions. (Ask the following questions, allowing time for the candidate to respond orally.)
part4A.listening_script: My name is Lisa and my best friend is Sam. Sam is 25 years old and works as a teacher. We meet every Saturday at 3 PM. We go to the café and drink coffee. After that, we walk in the park. We like to talk and laugh together. Sometimes, we visit the museum. I like Sam because he is funny and kind. We have a lot of fun together.
part4A.candidate_question_sheet_ref: Question Sheet for Part 4A – Candidate’s copy

part4B.name: Part 4B – Long turn and follow-up
instructions_interlocutor: Now you’re going to talk on your own for half a minute. Your topic is ______. You now have thirty seconds to write some notes to help you. You’re going to talk about your topic.
(When candidate has talked for a maximum of half a minute, say, ‘Thank you’, and then ask follow-up questions, as time allows.)
Thank you, (give candidate’s name). That is the end of the exam.

follow_up_questions.text: What is your favorite place in your city?
How many parks are in your city?
Do you like your city? Why?
What can people do in your city?
